string-array.name: answers
string-array.item: The launcher is the part of the Android user interface that lets users customize their home screen, launch applications, make phone calls, and perform other tasks on Android devices.
An icon pack is a set of graphics that will change the look of your app drawer icons.

You will need a launcher that supports custom icon packs. Supported launchers are listed in Delta\'s Play Store description. If you are confused on which launchers should be used, just go to the \"Apply\" section, and install a launcher from there.

You can open the navigation drawer, click on \"Apply\", and choose your launcher from the list. If your launcher is not listed but Delta is compatible with it (see Play Store description for supported launchers), you can apply Delta manually from your launcher settings.
You can open the navigation drawer then open \"Icons\".
Just tap the icon. A preview dialog will appear with a bigger image and the complete icon name.
It depends on which launcher you used. Not every launcher supports icon editing. Mostly, you can edit an icon by tapping and holding the icon, or double tapping it.
This occurred because Delta was moved to SD Card storage. You should install it into internal memory.
The problem might come from the way your launcher handles large icon resolutions. You can fix it by increasing the icon size to 115-120%. Alternatively, you can change your launcher.
Open settings, scroll down, and choose \"Report Bugs\".
\"Report Bugs\" is used to report bugs related to the icon pack, not the dashboard.
Not every launcher supports direct application, and some of them can\'t be accessed directly from the dashboard. You can apply this icon pack manually from your launcher\'s settings.

When you use \"Set Wallpaper\" directly from the app, it will be downloaded to the application\'s cache, then the dashboard app will try to apply it. Applying will take some time, and needs a huge amount of RAM for a short time. Black screen errors may appear because your phone doesn\'t have enough free RAM to process the wallpaper. Restarting your phone will fix this problem. After restarting, your phone will have more RAM available. Alternatively, you can open the downloaded wallpaper from your gallery and set it as your wallpaper from there.
Read and Write External Storage permission is needed to read and write cache, and collect icon request data.
Internet permission is needed to download Cloud-Based Wallpapers.
Set Wallpaper permission is needed to apply wallpapers directly from the dashboard app.
